text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Tataouine | native_name = تطاوين | native_name_lang = aeb | other_name = | type = Governorate | image_skyline = Moonlit landscape of Tataouine.jpg | image_alt = Moonlit landscape of Tataouine | image_caption = Moonlit landscape of Tataouine | image_shield = | shield_alt = | image_map = Tataouine in Tunisia.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Map of Tunisia with Tataouine highlighted | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Tunisia | established_title = Created | established_date = March 2, 1981 | seat_type = Capital | seat = Tataouine | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 38889 | area_rank = Ranked 1st of 24 | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 149453 | population_as_of = 2014 | population_rank = Ranked 23rd of 24 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01 | postal_code_type = Postal prefix | postal_code = xx | area_code_type = Calling code | area_code = | iso_code = TN-83 | website = | footnotes = }} Tataouine Governorate ( ) is one of the twenty-four governorates of Tunisia. It is in the southern part of the country, the only one to border both Algeria and Libya. It is also the largest governorate of the country by area. It covers an area of 38,889 km². As of the 2014 census, 149,453 people lived there. Census 2014 (National Institute of Statistics) The capital is Tataouine. == References == Category:1980s establishments in Tunisia Category:1981 establishments Category:Governorates of Tunisia
title: Tataouine Governorate
